main_definition: Watts is a unit of measurement representing the rate of energy transfer equivalent to one joule per second, commonly used in reference to electric power consumption.

meanings_and_examples.example: The lightbulb uses 60 watts of electrical energy.
When she entered the room, everyone noticed her wattage and felt energized by her presence.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Speed or velocity in a sports context
meanings_and_examples.example: The sprinter's fastest leg of the race was clocked at 9.58 seconds, demonstrating incredible watts on the track.
